titleStmt.title: Milk for babes. Drawn out of the breasts of both Testaments. Chiefly, for the spirituall nourishment of Boston babes in either England: but may be of like use for any children. By John Cotton, B.D. and teacher to the church of Boston in New-England.
titleStmt.author: Cotton, John, 1584-1652.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J. Coe, for Henry Overton, and are to be sold at his shop, in Popes-head Alley,

notesStmt.note: Reproductions of the originals in the British Library (Thomason Tracts) and in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery (Early English Books).
